title: Vishvarupa Darshana Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of the Vision of the Universal Form
summary: In this awe-inspiring chapter, Arjuna requests to see Krishna's divine universal form. Krishna grants him divine vision and reveals His spectacular Vishvarupa - a boundless, terrifying, and magnificent cosmic manifestation containing all beings, worlds, and time itself. Overwhelmed by this vision, Arjuna sees the divine destroying and recreating all creation, with warriors on both sides already slain within Krishna's fiery mouths. After this terrifying revelation of Krishna's destructive aspect as Time, Arjuna apologizes for his previous casual familiarity and begs Krishna to return to His gentle four-armed Vishnu form. Krishna explains that this supreme vision is rarely seen and can only be beheld through pure devotion.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम् | यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | mad-anugrahāya paramaṃ guhyam adhyātma-saṃjñitam | yat tvayoktaṃ vacas tena moho 'yaṃ vigato mama ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: By Your mercy, You have revealed to me this supreme secret concerning the Self. By these words, my delusion is dispelled.
verses.explanation: Arjuna acknowledges Krishna's teachings have removed his confusion about duty.

verses.sanskrit: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया | त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṃ śrutau vistaraśo mayā | tvattaḥ kamala-patrākṣa māhātmyam api cāvyayam ||
verses.translation: O lotus-eyed one, I have heard from You in detail about the origin and dissolution of beings, and Your imperishable glory.
verses.explanation: Arjuna confirms his understanding of Krishna's cosmic nature.

verses.sanskrit: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर | द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम ||
verses.transliteration: evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṃ parameśvara | draṣṭum icchāmi te rūpam aiśvaraṃ puruṣottama ||
verses.translation: O Supreme Lord, as You have thus described Yourself, O Supreme Person, I wish to see Your divine form.
verses.explanation: Arjuna requests a direct vision of Krishna's divine form.

verses.sanskrit: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो | योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: manyase yadi tac chakyaṃ mayā draṣṭum iti prabho | yoga-īśvara tato me tvaṃ darśayātmānam avyayam ||
verses.translation: O Lord of all mystic power, if You think it possible for me to see it, then kindly show me Your imperishable Self.
verses.explanation: Arjuna humbly submits his request to Krishna's will.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः | नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ | nānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛtīni ca ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, behold My forms by the hundreds and thousands, of different kinds, celestial, and of various colors and shapes.
verses.explanation: Krishna begins to reveal His cosmic form.

verses.sanskrit: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा | बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत ||
verses.transliteration: paśyādityān vasūn rudrān aśvinau marutas tathā | bahūny adṛṣṭa-pūrvāṇi paśyāścaryāṇi bhārata ||
verses.translation: O descendant of Bharata, behold the Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, the two Ashvins, and the Maruts. Behold many wonders never seen before.
verses.explanation: Krishna shows divine beings and cosmic phenomena within Himself.

verses.sanskrit: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् | मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ||
verses.transliteration: ihaika-sthaṃ jagat kṛtsnaṃ paśyādya sa-carācaram | mama dehe guḍākeśa yac cānyad draṣṭum icchasi ||
verses.translation: O Gudakesha, now behold the entire creation - moving and unmoving - assembled here in My body, and whatever else you wish to see.
verses.explanation: The entire universe is revealed within Krishna's cosmic form.

verses.sanskrit: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा | दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ||
verses.transliteration: na tu māṃ śakyase draṣṭum anenaiva sva-cakṣuṣā | divyaṃ dadāmi te cakṣuḥ paśya me yogam aiśvaram ||
verses.translation: But you cannot see Me with your present eyes. Therefore I give you divine sight. Behold My majestic mystic power!
verses.explanation: Krishna grants Arjuna divine vision to perceive His cosmic form.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच | एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः | दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम् ||
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca | evam uktvā tato rājan mahā-yogeśvaro hariḥ | darśayām āsa pārthāya paramaṃ rūpam aiśvaram ||
verses.translation: Sanjaya said: O King, having thus spoken, the great Lord of Yoga, Hari, showed Arjuna His supreme divine form.
verses.explanation: Sanjaya narrates to Dhritarashtra how Krishna revealed His cosmic form.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् | अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् ||
verses.transliteration: aneka-vaktra-nayanam anekādbhuta-darśanam | aneka-divyābharaṇaṃ divyānekodyatāyudham ||
verses.translation: With numerous faces and eyes, presenting many wondrous sights, adorned with many celestial ornaments, wielding many divine uplifted weapons.
verses.explanation: Description of Krishna's awe-inspiring cosmic form.

verses.sanskrit: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् | सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् ||
verses.transliteration: divya-mālyāmbara-dharaṃ divya-gandhānulepanam | sarvāścarya-mayaṃ devam anantaṃ viśvato-mukham ||
verses.translation: Wearing celestial garlands and garments, anointed with divine fragrances, all-wonderful, resplendent, unlimited, with faces on all sides.
verses.explanation: Further description of the cosmic form's splendor.

verses.sanskrit: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता | यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः ||
verses.transliteration: divi sūrya-sahasrasya bhaved yugapad utthitā | yadi bhāḥ sadṛśī sā syād bhāsas tasya mahātmanaḥ ||
verses.translation: If the splendor of thousands of suns were to blaze forth all at once in the sky, that might resemble the splendor of that great Being.
verses.explanation: The unimaginable radiance of Krishna's cosmic form compared to thousands of suns.

verses.sanskrit: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा | अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा ||
verses.transliteration: tatraika-sthaṃ jagat kṛtsnaṃ pravibhaktam anekadhā | apaśyad deva-devasya śarīre pāṇḍavas tadā ||
verses.translation: There, in the body of the God of gods, Arjuna then saw the entire universe resting as one, yet divided into many.
verses.explanation: Arjuna perceives the unified yet diversified universe within Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः | प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत ||
verses.transliteration: tataḥ sa vismayāviṣṭo hṛṣṭa-romā dhanañjayaḥ | praṇamya śirasā devaṃ kṛtāñjalir abhāṣata ||
verses.translation: Then, filled with wonder and his hairs standing on end, Dhananjaya bowed his head to the Lord and spoke with folded hands.
verses.explanation: Arjuna's awestruck reaction to the cosmic vision.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसंघान् | ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थमृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान् ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | paśyāmi devāṃs tava deva dehe sarvāṃs tathā bhūta-viśeṣa-saṅghān | brahmāṇam īśaṃ kamalāsana-stham ṛṣīṃś ca sarvān uragāṃś ca divyān ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Lord, I see within Your body all the gods and multitudes of various beings - Lord Brahma seated on the lotus, all the sages, and divine serpents.
verses.explanation: Arjuna describes seeing all cosmic beings within Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् | नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप ||
verses.transliteration: aneka-bāhūdara-vaktra-netraṃ paśyāmi tvāṃ sarvato 'nanta-rūpam | nāntaṃ na madhyaṃ na punas tavādiṃ paśyāmi viśveśvara viśva-rūpa ||
verses.translation: O Lord of the universe, I see You with infinite forms, with many arms, stomachs, faces, and eyes, without end, middle, or beginning.
verses.explanation: Arjuna struggles to comprehend the limitless cosmic form.

verses.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तमिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव | तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते ||
verses.transliteration: kirīṭinaṃ gadinaṃ cakra-hastam icchāmi tvāṃ draṣṭum ahaṃ tathaiva | tenaiva rūpeṇa catur-bhujena sahasra-bāho bhava viśva-mūrte ||
verses.translation: O universal form, I wish to see You as the four-armed Vishnu, crowned, holding mace and discus. O thousand-armed one, assume that four-armed form.
verses.explanation: Overwhelmed, Arjuna asks to see Krishna's familiar four-armed form.

verses.sanskrit: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो | योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: manyase yadi tac chakyaṃ mayā draṣṭum iti prabho | yoga-īśvara tato me tvaṃ darśayātmānam avyayam ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, by My grace, through My divine power, I have shown you this supreme, resplendent, universal form.
verses.explanation: Krishna explains this vision is granted by special grace.

verses.sanskrit: एतद्रूपमिदं मम दिव्यमेतद्यदृच्छया | न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानैर्न च क्रियाभिः | न तपोभिर्घोरैरेवंरूपः शक्योऽहं नृलोके द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर ||
verses.transliteration: etad rūpam idaṃ mama divyam etad yadṛcchayā | na veda-yajñādhyayanair na dānair na ca kriyābhiḥ | na tapobhir ghorair evaṃ-rūpaḥ śakyo 'haṃ nṛ-loke draṣṭuṃ tvad anyena kuru-pravīra ||
verses.translation: O best of the Kurus, neither by study of the Vedas, nor by sacrifices, nor by charity, nor by rituals, nor by severe austerities can I be seen in this form in the world of men by anyone else but you.
verses.explanation: This vision cannot be attained by ordinary religious practices.

verses.sanskrit: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् | व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य ||
verses.transliteration: mā te vyathā mā ca vimūḍha-bhāvo dṛṣṭvā rūpaṃ ghoram īdṛṅ mamedam | vyapeta-bhīḥ prīta-manāḥ punas tvaṃ tad eva me rūpam idaṃ prapaśya ||
verses.translation: Do not be disturbed or bewildered by seeing this terrible form of Mine. Free from fear and glad at heart, behold again My previous form.
verses.explanation: Krishna comforts the terrified Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच | इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः | आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा ||
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca | ity arjunaṃ vāsudevas tathoktvā svakaṃ rūpaṃ darśayām āsa bhūyaḥ | āśvāsayām āsa ca bhītam enaṃ bhūtvā punaḥ saumya-vapur mahātmā ||
verses.translation: Sanjaya said: Having thus spoken to Arjuna, Vasudeva showed His own form again. The great-souled one, assuming His gentle form, pacified the frightened Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Krishna returns to His familiar two-armed form.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन | इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः ||
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca | dṛṣṭvedaṃ mānuṣaṃ rūpaṃ tava saumyaṃ janārdana | idānīm asmi saṃvṛttaḥ sa-cetāḥ prakṛtiṃ gataḥ ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Janardana, seeing this Your gentle human form, I have now regained my composure and returned to my normal state.
verses.explanation: Arjuna recovers from his terror.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम | देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | su-durdarśam idaṃ rūpaṃ dṛṣṭavān asi yan mama | devā apy asya rūpasya nityaṃ darśana-kāṅkṣiṇaḥ ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: This form of Mine which you have seen is very difficult to behold. Even the gods are ever eager to see this form.
verses.explanation: Krishna emphasizes the rarity of this vision.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया | शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ||
verses.transliteration: nāhaṃ vedair na tapasā na dānena na cejyayā | śakya evaṃ-vidho draṣṭuṃ dṛṣṭavān asi māṃ yathā ||
verses.translation: Not by study of the Vedas, nor by austerities, nor by charity, nor by sacrifice can I be seen in this form as you have seen Me.
verses.explanation: Reiterating that this vision comes only through divine grace.

verses.sanskrit: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन | ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप ||
verses.transliteration: bhaktyā tv ananyayā śakya aham evaṃ-vidho 'rjuna | jñātuṃ draṣṭuṃ ca tattvena praveṣṭuṃ ca parantapa ||
verses.translation: O Arjuna, conqueror of foes, only by unalloyed devotion can I be known and seen in this form, and entered into in truth.
verses.explanation: Pure devotion is the only means to truly know Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय | निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ||
verses.transliteration: mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṃ niveśaya | nivasiṣyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṃ na saṃśayaḥ ||
verses.translation: Fix your mind on Me, place your intellect in Me, and you shall doubtless live in Me hereafter.
verses.explanation: Krishna's concluding instruction - complete absorption in Him.
